name: heat and power co-generation unit construction, 1MWel, 6.4 MWth | solvent, organic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15613/documentation

This activity represents the construction and deconstruction of a heat and power cogeneration unit working on an Organic Rankine Cycle with a capacity of 1MWel and 6.4 MWth. The dataset was created for modelling power production in a deep geothermal power plant. ;Detailed information on this dataset is presented in the book "Energy from the Earth. 2015. Hirschberg, Wiemer, Burgherr (eds.) (see field "Data Generator and Publication").

Starting from the materials and land available for the construction of the building and the machines

Ends with decommissioning of the plant.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

publication.name: S Hirchberg, S Wiemer, P Burgherr2015

flow.name: solvent, organic
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products

exchanges.description:
Literature value/estimation. The amount of steel mass is estimated based on a 1MW plant in Rogge (2004). Weights of the different ORC components: Evaporator (11t), boiler (4t), turbine (3t), generator (4t), pump for working fluid (1t), condenser of the organic circulating fluid (16t).

Rogge, S. (2004). Geothermische Stromerzeugung in Deutschland. Ökonomie, Ökologie und Potenziale. Technical University Berlin, Germany.

exchanges.description:
Literature value. The inventory for the heat and power cogenerating unit is basically taken from Bauer 2007, with some extrapolations. 

Bauer, C. (2007) Holzenergie. In: Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. Final report ecoinvent No. 6-IX, Paul Scherrer Institut Villigen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.

exchanges.description:
Calculated from an input of 300kg Perfluoropentane (Density 1.664g/ml) and a desnity of 0.874g/ml for Benzene.
